election_record.label: Vermont 1820 Lieutenant Governor

overview.note: The Original Election Returns, The Vermont Intelligencer, and Bellows Falls Advertiser (Bellows Falls, VT) and The Vermont Republican and American Yeoman (Windsor, VT) report 12097 votes for William Cahoon.

sub_unit.name: Caledonia
sub_unit.note: The Original Election Returns tally sheet lists 1179 votes for William Cahoon in Caledonia County; however, the sum of totals per town is 1059.

sub_unit.name: Mansfield
sub_unit.note: The Original Election Returns note that in Mansfield there were "no ballots."

sub_unit.name: Essex
sub_unit.note: The Original Election Returns tally sheet lists no scattering votes in Essex County.

sub_unit.name: Berkshire
sub_unit.note: The Original Election Returns note that votes in Berkshire were "lost."

sub_unit.name: Roxbury
sub_unit.note: The Original Election Returns note that votes in Roxbury were "not enclosed; rejected ballots."

sub_unit.name: Rutland
sub_unit.note: The Original Election Returns tally sheet lists 1885 votes for William Cahoon in Rutland County; however, the sum of totals per town is 1845.

sub_unit.name: Windham
sub_unit.note: The Original Election Returns tally sheet lists 327 scattering votes in Windham County; however, the sum of totals per town is 346.

sub_unit.name: Windsor
sub_unit.note: The Original Election Returns tally sheet lists 2044 votes for William Cahoon in Windsor County; however, the sum of totals per town is 2025.

election_record.reference: Original Election Returns. Vermont State Archives, Middlesex.
Vermont Intelligencer, and Bellows Falls Advertiser (Bellows Falls, VT). October 23, 1820.
Vermont Republican and American Yeoman (Windsor, VT). October 23, 1820.
